title: Chi Zhang
text:
Twitter

     Github
  

  
  
Chi is a researcher at the Norwegian Institute of Public Health (Folkehelseinstituttet). She is a statistician and R programmer at Sykdomspulsen, a real-time analysis and public health surveillance system.
Chi has recently earned her PhD at University of Oslo. Her thesis is Representation and utilization of hospital Electronic Health Records data.
Chi also has a 20% position as a statistical advisor at the Oslo Centre for Biostatistics and Epidemiology (OCBE).

title: Projects
text:
I joined the Norwegian Institute of Public Health in 2020, as a member of the Sykdomspulsen team. We are a core part of the COVID-19 pandemic response task force in Norway. I help build the real-time public health surveillance platform using R and other open source data science tools. You can find our R packages here.
In 2021-2022, I am the responsible statistician for NorMOMO, the Norwegian Mortality Monitoring project, which is part of the European network EuroMOMO. I work on R packages nowcast and splalert.

title: Projects
text:
Academic Research
I have earned my PhD from University of Oslo in 2022. My PhD research was on the representation and utilization of hospital electronic health records data.

title: Projects
text:
Advising
I work as a statistical advisor on the side, helping clinical researchers with methodology and anaysis.

title: Projects
text:
Community
I am an active member of Oslo User R group and Oslo R ladies group.
In addition, I am a certified Capentry instructor.
